website_summaries.verdict: Microsoft's answer to Sony's EyeToy camera, the affordable Xbox Live Vision Camera for Xbox 360 may not yet be a must-have Xbox 360 accessory, but we suspect that as Microsoft upgrades Xbox Live to include more Vision features, it will be.
pros: Microsoft's slickly designed Xbox Live Vision for Xbox 360 is a relatively inexpensive, USB Web-cam-style video camera that allows you to video-chat online with other Xbox Live gamers

You can also use the camera to add still images to your text messages and your gamertag picture, not to mention that some upcoming games will allow you to map your face to your in-game player using the camera

We also like the shimmering water effect the camera puts on the background of the Xbox Live menu system, not to mention that when you're in music mode on your Xbox 360, you can play with the visualization with hand gestures
Lastly, the Xbox Live Vision camera can double as a Web cam on your PC or Mac
cons: Image quality for still photos is pretty mediocre and only a handful of games are currently Vision-enabled

customer_reviews.title: Xbox 360 Live Vision Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am a Mac user and will share my experience with this webcam on Macs running Mac OS X. This is a pretty decent webcam and it works with the Mac without drivers. Note-- it will NOT work on USB 1 ports! You need USB 2 ports (i have a PowerMac G4 and i added usb 2 ports via pci expansion cards) The video quality is pretty good. You could twist the front lens for sharpness or softness of image. Works well with photobooth. Works well as a low end security cam too with EvoCam software (shareware sold separately; can be found on macupdate.com) This is a pretty good webcam for the price (under $15).
customer_reviews.author: Mick Maestro

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: This webcam is truly plug and play with the Xbox 360 and my Windows Vista computer. The quality on this camera is amazing for the price. I frequently use the camera to video conference with family on the west coast. However, as any photographer knows. lighting is critical. If you use this camera with only backlighting, there will be some quality issues. Overhead lighting or frontal lighting mitigates or eliminates all issues. Whatever you do, avoid open and bright sunlit windows behind you when using the camera (or any camera for that matter). Even if you just place a small lamp next to or in front of the subject, your video will be greatly improved.
customer_reviews.author: ReconScout

customer_reviews.title: Basic webcam - serves the purpose at a great price . . .
customer_reviews.text: This Xbox 360 Live Vision Camera was well worth the $10 price. It is a "no-frills" camera that is a true "plug-and-play" for the Xbox 360 and serves its purpose well . . . for our 12-year-old son to "see" his friends while playing on Xbox Live. An added benefit is that it also allows us (his parents) to "see" who our son is gaming with. Comes with an extra-long USB connection cord, has both auto-focus and manual focus adjustment, adjusts well to minimal background lighting, and allows for snap-shot pictures which can be used as a personal avatar and even inserted into some Xbox games as an overlay for the characters. I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Bill Beaulac

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Xbox 360 for video chatting
customer_reviews.text: I used this with my Xbox 360 Slim for video chatting with friends across the country. Worked great and even has a focusing ring which was a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera, but MS doesn't max its potential
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence about this camera, but decided to go for it when I read that it can also be used on a PC. This is my first webcam and I've had a lot of fun with it. That being said, there isn't much on LIVE that you can use it with unless you love UNO for long periods. The lack of titles that can use this camera should deter anyone who wants to be anonymous on LIVE and not reveal your mug. Of course, you could point the camera at something else and still play the few games out there.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Gooding

customer_reviews.title: Works As Replacement Camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement camera for an older Mac where the camera had gone out but the audio still worked. Easy to connect, no special software needed, just have to remember to turn the camera on before using Skype or FaceTime. Does NOT have audio, so be sure your audio works if you are considering this model. It solved our problem cheaply.
customer_reviews.author: Deb D

customer_reviews.title: The Wonderful World of Peripherals
customer_reviews.text: Here is another peripheral for the XBOX 360. This is a very small camera, which easily plugs into your 360's USB port and after that you can have minutes of fun looking at reversed images of yourself and your family. You can even have your face scanned and have your image on a character in "Rainbow Six: Las Vegas" when your on XBOX Live. You can even hook it up to your computer (after downloading the appropriate drivers) and look at your self there. Other than that it's pretty useless. Here's hoping that Microsoft expands on this idea, soon. I gave it 3 stars because it works but there are not many uses for this thing as of now.
customer_reviews.author: E.I.E.I. Owen

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Mac Webcam
customer_reviews.text: the Xbox 360 Live Vision Camera is a USB video class (UVC) device, which means it works out of the box with any modern Mac. Installation couldn't have been simpler. I simply plugged the webcam into my MacPro, and Skype picked it up, instantly. The only down sides are, no built in microphone and no autofocus. But if you have a built in mic, or a headset, that's not really a big issue. I'd recommend this webcam to any Mac user who wants an inexpensive, quality webcam that "Just Works".
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Does not work side by side with my Kinect the Kinect have too be unplugged for it too work.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect with my xbox 360 and love the water effect too my profile.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Jonesjr

customer_reviews.title: Like sending pictures to friends or the mirror effect on ...
customer_reviews.text: Has a lot of little features i didn't know about. Like sending pictures to friends or the mirror effect on the avatar select screen.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this on Tuesday and I just received it in the mail today, Friday. Very reasonable price, but when I received the package you actually are getting the "You're in the Movies" package. You get a game and the webcam. I would purchase from this seller again, but the pictures are wrong advertising making you think you are purchasing a webcam, headset and possibly a 1 month free trial of xbox live.
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: Camera is great but...
customer_reviews.text: This add is very deceiving. You do get the camera, but not with the retail packaging and not with the headset! The item also did not come with a printed receipt. The camera is one of the best cameras I have ever used especially for the price. I have used it on many computers but never had to install any drivers. It just works.
customer_reviews.author: dannfort

customer_reviews.title: Does what it does. No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it does, though the resolution is extremely low (as expected for 640x480), but what can I say? It's an old device, but it still works well if you don't want to spend much money and don't mind going for lower resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Hang

customer_reviews.title: Perfect out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive camera replaced an expensive malfunctioning iSight camera. Just as good, and most importantly, it works great. It is plugged into a brand new iMac running Lion. We need an external camera because this is a dental office and we capture faces of all of our patients to recognize them when they come in.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Binder

customer_reviews.title: Yes! It works on a Mac, perfectly, just plug it in
customer_reviews.text: This web cam for the x-box, made by Microsoft is a great replacement for all of those people who own a Mac without a built in camera. There's no software to install, or settings to mess with or adjust. It works great with iChat or Yahoo Chat, just click on the web cam button and you'll see the live view come on. And it's cheap, I bought mine for less than ten dollars and I saw a new one at Game Stop for under twenty dollars.
customer_reviews.author: George G. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Works great even in low light
customer_reviews.text: Great little unit. Allows for the use of video in the older games that don't recognize the Kinect camera. I would recommend leaving the settings on auto if you play in low light as it seems to be able to give a better image overall than the manual settings. Only reason for 4 stars is that the focus ring is a pain. You wind up moving the camera almost every time you are trying to adjust it and it is hard to get adjusted properly without a second person there to sit in your location while you twist it.
customer_reviews.author: Morris

customer_reviews.title: Works great for both Xbox abnd PC!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for both the Xbox 360 and even for a PC. For some reason though, it could be used as a webcam and camera on PC but only as a camera on the Xbox 360. I think it's just a problem with the Xbox OS.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good.
customer_reviews.text: This is not really a necesity but more of a luxury. It can't be used with every game. The only reason why I purchased it was because you can take pictures of yourself and put them on your licenses in a couple racing games. Not really a necesity but if you have the money to get it then it will serve its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: BronsonC

customer_reviews.title: works with a ibook
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my girlfriend. She has an old ibook G4. If you have Mac OSX 10.4 or higher, the camera will function flawlessly with ichat without the need of drivers. Great picture and the frames per second are not choppy but flow smooth. Also the lens focuses so you can make the picture crystal clear.
customer_reviews.author: Haunted Spider

customer_reviews.title: Great iSight alternative for Mac users
customer_reviews.text: With the iSight no longer for sale, there are few alternatives for users of older Macs looking to use the video features of iChat AV. This camera works perfectly. The quality is decent and it's very small. Not a ton of extra features, but it works right out of the box without any other software. That is far better than lots of bells and whistles that only work OK. I don't own an xBox and can't speak to how this camera is for that, but it's a great camera to use with my computer and far cheaper (and better) than most aftermarket webcams.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wegman

customer_reviews.title: webcam for macbook
customer_reviews.text: after my built-in isight camera malfunctioned, and not wanted to spend a fortune trying to figure out if i could get it to work or not, i purchased a microsoft vx5000 for my husband's pc which caused all sorts of problems that i won't go into here. frustrated, i searched for a less expensive alternative for my mac, and figured for 25 bucks i'd try this xbox camera. i just received it, plugged it in, and used it with photobooth immediately. thanks to another reviewer, i was able to make the picture a little crisper by using the focus ring, and we're good to go! next use is for skype...
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.text: To be honest, the 360 wasn't made to seriously utilize this camera. It has a few effects but really is more of a novelty. Hopefully, in the next incarnation of the X-Box, it will be better utilized. Maybe it can be used for web-conferencing.

customer_reviews.title: Don't use for outdoor camera!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera on the basis of online reviews saying it was great, and I wanted a camera with manual focus, and I didn't need a mic. However, I planned to use it pointed out the window, and the outdoor light blows out the picture - strangely enough, it is ok to a point at which it suddenly is completely overexposed (could be mac driver under os x leopard, or internal to the camera). So, it works as advertised I believe, indoors - but don't subject it to extremely bright light, the type which is common out the window with full sun or snow cover under sunlight.

customer_reviews.title: Xbox Live Vision Review
customer_reviews.text: The Xbox Live Vision camera is a great product. It uses the USB interface and you can use it with your computer as well. While it's plugged into the xbox, and you are in the xbox dashboard, it uses the camera's vision as a watery background which creates ripples as you move. It's fun to play games like Uno with it and you can take pictures and send them to friends or use as your default picture.

Happy to find this on here,because they're not sold in stores around here anymore!!

customer_reviews.text: I started looking for a camera to use with my Apple Powerbook in early December, since the iSight is no longer manufactured as a stand-alone camera and is outrageously expensive used. To my surprise, many websites recommended the XBox 360 Live Vision Camera. The camera is USB, and works perfectly with iChat and Photobooth upon plugging it in. Good picture, adjustable focus. The one downside - the cable to the camera seems excessively long.

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing picture/video quality, pretty good durability, and relatively cheap. this thing reads better than a freaking Kinect and costs way less.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory
customer_reviews.text: Very awesome. It came very fast. Was a brand new product. The shipper even through in a free extra gift. I greatly appreciate it and recommend people to order from them.

customer_reviews.title: Vision camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent timing on receiving it! Got it before they said it would be here! I am Very satisfied with the product!!
customer_reviews.author: Tnt9593

customer_reviews.title: Xbox 360 webcam
customer_reviews.text: Im really dissatisfied with my Webcam i was expecting to get one that worked. but it doesnt work properly and its really frusterating because it only stays on for about 20 seconds then it turns off for 5+ minutes then turns back on for 20 seconds and repeat. i bought this so i could keep in touch with my best friend because we moved across state from them, but obviosly thats not possible with thiis webcam.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Clearly not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: After misplacing my first vision camera I finally decided to purchase a new one after a couple years. This package was just what I needed too. My Xbox LIVE gold membership was out and I had no working headset at the time. Although, the Vision camera package I received was clearly not in any acceptable condition. The camera itself had a sticky substance along the focusing ring. The codes for both the 1 month subscription and UNO game had already been used. The wired headset was also missing.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Xbox camera works great!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it...just works great enough to see who he's playing online with...
customer_reviews.author: Aisha Aparicio

product_meta.title: Xbox 360 Live Vision Camera
product_meta.description: The Xbox Live Vision video camera seamlessly integrates with the Xbox 360 system and Xbox Live network to bring interactive social gaming to life. The camera allows gamers to personalize their gaming experience with their own unique gamer picture, send photo messages, and chat by video with friends and family over Xbox Live
feature_bullets: Bring motion based games to life using your own body movements to control the action
Support games designed with 'face in game' technology for a personalized gaming experience - add your face to your character in-game
Supports up to VGA 640H x 480V video @ 30 frames per second
